articles.title: UPDATE 1-Fed policymakers agree rates on hold for 'a time'
articles.description: U.S. Federal Reserve policymakers agreed in their final policy meeting of 2019 that interest rates were likely to stay on hold for "a time" as the central bank set its sights on a new articulation of its monetary policy framework.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Federal Reserve policymakers agreed in their final policy meeting of 2019 that interest rates were likely to stay on hold for “a time” as the central bank set its sights on a new articulation of its monetary policy framework.

articles.title: Soleimani planned to attack U.S. personnel in Iraq, Lebanon, Syria, elsewhere: Trump administration official
articles.description: Qassem Soleimani, Tehran's most prominent military commander, was planning imminent attacks on U.S. diplomats and armed forces in Iraq, Lebanon, Syria and elsewhere in the Middle East, a senior Trump administration official said on Friday.

articles.title: Paris knife attacker had mental health issues, Koran found on him: prosecutors
articles.description: A Koran was found in the bag of a man shot dead by French police on Friday after he went on rampage with a knife in a park near Paris, killing one person and wounding two others.
articles.content:
PARIS (Reuters) - A Koran was found in the bag of a man shot dead by French police on Friday after he went on rampage with a knife in a park near Paris, killing one person and wounding two others.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Trump says ordered killing of Iranian general to prevent war, not start one
articles.description: President Donald Trump said on Friday he ordered the killing of Qassem Soleimani to stop a war, not start one, saying the Iranian military commander was planning imminent attacks on Americans.
articles.content:
PALM BEACH, Fla. (Reuters) - President Donald Trump said on Friday he ordered the killing of Qassem Soleimani to stop a war, not start one, saying the Iranian military commander was planning imminent attacks on Americans.

articles.title: U.S. deportations of Guatemalans doubled over past decade
articles.description: The administration of U.S. President Donald Trump stepped up deportations of Guatemalans in 2019, doubling the number of migrants sent back from the United States a decade earlier, migration data from the Central American country showed on Friday.

articles.title: Turkish court formally arrests five suspects over Ghosn's transit - Anadolu
articles.description: A Turkish court ruled on Friday to formally arrest five suspects who were detained as part of an investigation into ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn's transit through Turkey after fleeing Japan, state-owned Anadolu news agency reported.
articles.content:
ISTANBUL (Reuters) - A Turkish court ruled on Friday to formally arrest five suspects who were detained as part of an investigation into ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn’s transit through Turkey after fleeing Japan, state-owned Anadolu news agency reported.

articles.title: Bahrain calls for de-escalation after U.S. air strike in Iraq: state news agency
articles.description: Bahrain said on Friday it is following the developments in Iraq and called for de-escalation after a U.S. air strike, according to the state news agency.
articles.content:
CAIRO (Reuters) - Bahrain said on Friday it is following the developments in Iraq and called for de-escalation after a U.S. air strike, according to the state news agency. 
A U.S. air strike killed Qassem Soleimani, architect of Iran’s spreading military inf… [+88 chars]

articles.title: FCC says it will accept comments until February 3 on Huawei, ZTE security risks
articles.description: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) said on Friday it will accept public comments until Feb. 3 on its determination that China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd and ZTE Corp <000063.SZ> pose national security risks.
articles.content:

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Methodist church plans to split over gay marriage
articles.description: The United Methodist Church plans to split into two denominations later this year, church officials said on Friday, a schism that follows years of contention over whether the church should end its ban on gay marriage and ordination of gay clergy.
articles.content:
Posted 
The United Methodist Church plans to split into two denominations later this year, church officials said on Friday, a schism that follows years of contention over whether the church should end its ban on gay marriage and ordination of gay clergy.

articles.title: Exclusive: Canada's First Quantum weighs $1 billion Zambian copper mine expansion - document
